metadata.name: GcpStagingFrontendIssues
metadata.description: Comprehensive analysis and test coverage for GCP staging frontend issues

analysis.summary: Created comprehensive failing tests to replicate the exact issues found in GCP staging logs for the Frontend service. The tests document current problems and provide clear expectations for fixes.

issue.title: API Proxy Configuration Failures
issue.description: Frontend service incorrectly trying to proxy requests to localhost:8000 instead of using direct staging backend URLs (https://api.staging.netrasystems.ai)
issue.root_cause: - Next.js rewrites still enabled in production/staging - Environment detection not properly disabling development proxy behavior - Configuration using localhost URLs even in staging environment

issue.title: Missing Health Endpoints (404 Errors)
issue.description: Health endpoints /health and /health/ready returning 404 errors in staging, indicating requests are hitting frontend service instead of backend service
issue.root_cause: - Kubernetes health probes misconfigured to hit frontend service - Load balancer/ingress routing health requests to wrong service - Frontend service attempting to handle backend health endpoints locally
issue.test_coverage: - gcp-staging-issues-replication.test.tsx - Issue #2 section - health-endpoints-404-errors.test.tsx - comprehensive health endpoint testing

issue.title: Missing API Routes (404 Errors)
issue.description: Critical API endpoints returning 404: /api/config/public, /api/threads, /api/threads These are essential for frontend initialization and core chat functionality
issue.root_cause: - API endpoints not properly registered or accessible in backend service - Ingress configuration directing API calls to frontend instead of backend - Backend service might not be running or accessible in staging - API client making requests to incorrect URLs
issue.test_coverage: - gcp-staging-issues-replication.test.tsx - Issue #3 section - missing-api-routes.test.tsx - comprehensive API endpoint testing

issue.title: Missing Static Assets
issue.description: Static assets like favicon.ico returning 404 errors, causing browser console errors and impacting application polish
issue.root_cause: - Static assets not properly built/copied in staging deployment - Next.js static file serving not configured correctly for staging - Docker build process not including static assets - CDN or static file serving misconfiguration
issue.test_coverage: - gcp-staging-issues-replication.test.tsx - Issue #4 section - missing-static-assets.test.tsx - comprehensive static asset testing

test_strategy.approach: Each test is designed to FAIL initially, demonstrating the current broken state. Tests include detailed comments explaining root causes and expected behavior. Tests are organized by issue type for easy navigation and fixes.

file.name: gcp-staging-issues-replication.test.tsx
file.purpose: Main test file covering all four primary issues
file.coverage: - API proxy configuration failures - Health endpoint 404 errors - API route 404 errors - Static asset 404 errors - Additional staging configuration issues

file.name: health-endpoints-404-errors.test.tsx
file.purpose: Deep dive into health endpoint routing problems
file.coverage: - Frontend vs backend health endpoint confusion - Kubernetes health probe misconfiguration - Service mesh/ingress routing issues - Network configuration diagnosis

file.name: missing-api-routes.test.tsx
file.purpose: Comprehensive testing of API endpoint failures
file.coverage: - /api/config/public endpoint missing - /api/threads endpoint failures - API client wrapper integration issues - Backend service availability problems - Ingress/load balancer misconfigurations

file.name: missing-static-assets.test.tsx
file.purpose: Static asset serving and optimization issues
file.coverage: - favicon.ico and standard web assets - Next.js static asset generation - CDN and static file serving configuration - Deployment-specific static asset issues - Performance impact analysis

environment_detection.finding: Environment detection logic in unified-api-config.ts correctly identifies staging but proxy configuration in next.config.ts may still be active in production builds

url_configuration.problem: Tests suggest some components may still be using localhost URLs or proxy paths instead of the correct direct staging URLs

routing_issues.health_endpoints: Expected: https://api.staging.netrasystems.ai/health/ready Actual: https://app.staging.netrasystems.ai/health/ready (404) Problem: Health requests hitting frontend service instead of backend
routing_issues.api_endpoints: Expected: https://api.staging.netrasystems.ai/api/threads Actual: Requests may be going to wrong service or backend not accessible Problem: API routing misconfiguration or backend service issues

static_assets.missing_files: - favicon.ico (most critical - browsers automatically request this) - robots.txt (SEO impact) - manifest.json (PWA support, optional) - apple-touch-icon.png (mobile support, optional)
static_assets.build_configuration: Next.js output: 'standalone' mode may affect static asset serving Docker build process may not be copying public directory correctly

fix.title: Fix Health Endpoint Routing
fix.description: Ensure Kubernetes health probes and load balancer health checks target backend service directly, not frontend service
fix.action: Update Kubernetes deployment configurations and ingress rules to route /health/* requests to backend service pods

fix.title: Fix API Endpoint Routing
fix.description: Ensure all /api/* requests are routed to backend service, and backend service is accessible in staging
fix.action: - Verify backend service deployment in staging - Update ingress/load balancer configuration - Ensure API client uses correct staging URLs

fix.title: Add Missing Static Assets
fix.description: Add favicon.ico and other standard web assets to eliminate 404 errors
fix.action: - Add favicon.ico to public directory - Verify Docker build includes static assets - Test static asset serving in staging

fix.title: Disable Development Proxy in Staging
fix.description: Ensure Next.js rewrites are completely disabled in production/staging
fix.action: - Verify next.config.ts rewrites() returns empty array in production - Ensure environment detection works correctly in build process

running_tests.expected_result: All tests should FAIL initially, documenting current issues
running_tests.after_fixes: Tests should PASS after implementing the required fixes

continuous_monitoring.integration: Add these tests to CI/CD pipeline to prevent regression of staging issues
continuous_monitoring.staging_validation: Run these tests against live staging environment to validate fixes

service_separation.principle: Frontend and backend services must be clearly separated in staging/production. Frontend should never attempt to serve backend endpoints locally.
service_separation.implementation: - Frontend: Serves UI, handles client-side routing - Backend: Serves API endpoints, handles business logic - Clear separation prevents routing confusion

health_check_patterns.principle: Health checks should target the appropriate service directly. Frontend health checks â‰ Backend health checks.
health_check_patterns.implementation: - Backend health: /health, /health/ready on api.staging.netrasystems.ai - Frontend health: Custom Next.js health endpoint on app.staging.netrasystems.ai (if needed) - Kubernetes probes should be service-specific

environment_configuration.principle: Environment detection must be reliable and consistent across all components. Development proxy behavior must be completely disabled in production.
environment_configuration.implementation: - Use NEXT_PUBLIC_ENVIRONMENT for explicit environment control - Disable all development features in production/staging - Validate configuration in tests

testing.environment_specific_tests: Run staging-specific tests in CI/CD to catch configuration issues early
testing.end_to_end_validation: Include health endpoint and API endpoint validation in deployment process

monitoring.error_tracking: Monitor 404 errors in staging to quickly identify new configuration issues
monitoring.health_monitoring: Set up proper health check monitoring for both frontend and backend services

deployment.validation_checks: Add pre-deployment validation that verifies: - Static assets are included in build - Environment configuration is correct - Health endpoints are accessible - API endpoints respond correctly
